holidays.name: World Telecommunication and Information Society Day
holidays.description: A day to raise awareness of the possibilities that the use of the Internet and other information and communication technologies (ICT) can bring to societies and economies.
holidays.origin: Established by the International Telecommunication Union (ITU) to celebrate the creation of the ITU and the signing of the first International Telegraph Convention in 1865.
holidays.funFact: The day often highlights the importance of closing the digital divide, ensuring everyone can access modern communication tools.

holidays.name: International Day Against Homophobia, Transphobia and Biphobia
holidays.description: A day to raise awareness of the violence and discrimination experienced by LGBTQ+ people worldwide and to promote their rights.
holidays.origin: Established in 2004 to commemorate the World Health Organization‚Äôs decision to remove homosexuality from its list of mental disorders on May 17, 1990.
holidays.funFact: Millions wear purple on this day as a symbol of support and solidarity with LGBTQ+ communities.

holidays.name: Pack Rat Day
holidays.description: Celebrate your inner pack rat! This quirky holiday honors those who have a hard time throwing things away and love to collect odd and interesting stuff.
holidays.origin: Dusts off the excuse for keeping those weird souvenirs and junk that others might toss without a second thought.
holidays.funFact: Pack rats (actual rodents) are famous for their collections, often hoarding shiny or colorful objects in their nests.
